articles.title: Leah R. Koenig, PhD, MSPH
articles.contents:
Leah R. Koenig, MSPH
          
          
          CV
          
          
          Publications

          ☰
          
          
      
        
          
            
              
            
              Leah R. Koenig, PhD, MSPH
            
            
              
                
                    
                      
                        
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      
                        
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      
                        
                    
                  
                                  
            
          
        
        
        
          
            I am a research analyst with the
            Advancing New Standards in
            Reproductive Health team at UCSF. I apply quantitative
            research methods to policy-relevant issues in reproductive
            health. My current research examines the safety,
            effectiveness, patient experience, and health equity
            implications of novel methods of abortion care. I recently
            completed my PhD in Epidemiology and Translational Sciences
            at the University of California, San Francisco. I also hold
            a MSPH in Sexual & Reproductive Health from the Johns
            Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health and a BA from
            Wesleyan University.
            Education
            University of California, San Francisco
            | Ph.D. in Epidemiology and Translational Sciences | 2024 |
            NIH Predoctoral F31 and T32 Fellow
            Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public
            Health | M.S.P.H in Population, Family, and
            Reproductive Health | 2017
            Wesleyan University | B.A. with Honors
            in Social Studies | 2013
          
        
      
    

    
      
        
          
            
              
            
              Leah R. Koenig, PhD, MSPH
            
            
              
                
                                    
                    
                      
                  
                                    
                    
                      
                  
                                    
                    
                      
                  
                                  
              
            
            
              I am a research analyst with the
              Advancing New Standards
              in Reproductive Health team at UCSF. I apply
              quantitative research methods to policy-relevant issues in
              reproductive health. My current research examines the
              safety, effectiveness, patient experience, and health
              equity implications of novel methods of abortion care. I
              recently completed my PhD in Epidemiology and
              Translational Sciences at the University of California,
              San Francisco. I also hold a MSPH in Sexual &
              Reproductive Health from the Johns Hopkins Bloomberg
              School of Public Health and a BA from Wesleyan
              University.
              Education
              University of California, San
              Francisco | Ph.D. in Epidemiology and
              Translational Sciences | 2024 | NIH Predoctoral F31 and
              T32 Fellow
              Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public
              Health | M.S.P.H in Population, Family, and
              Reproductive Health | 2017
              Wesleyan University | B.A. with Honors
              in Social Studies | 2013

              Media
            
            
              
                
            
          
        
        
        
          
            2024
            
            
            New York Times, “Abortions by Telemedicine
            and Mailed Pills Are Safe and Effective, Study Finds”
            
            Stat
            News, “Abortion pills offered via telehealth as
            safe as in-person medication abortions, study finds” 
            
            2023
            
            Mother
            Jones, “A New Study on Medication Abortion Refutes
            the Arguments Conservatives Are Taking to the Supreme
            Court”
            
            States Newsroom, “Abortion rights advocates
            say consequences dire if SCOTUS declines to hear pill
            case”
            
            High Country News, “Navigating the new
            healthcare deserts: Post-Roe, startups help those seeking
            abortion shrink travel distances and carbon
            emissions”
            New
            York Times, “Are Abortion Pills Safe? Here’s the
            Evidence.”
            
            MSNBC, Morning Joe, “How the COVID pandemic
            impacted family planning”
            Forbes,
            “Women less keen to get pregnant since the pandemic began,
            new study shows”

             Book chapters 
            
            Koenig LR, Li M. Achieving Gender Equality:
            Understanding Gender Equality and Health among Vulnerable
            Adolescents in the Sustainable Development Goals Era. In P.
            Banati, editor, Sustainable Development Across the Life
            Course: Evidence from Longitudinal Research. 2020. Bristol
            University Press.
            
             Reports and Opinion Editorials 
            
            
            Koenig LR, Upadhyay UD. Telehealth makes
            timely abortions possible for many, research shows. The
            Conversation. 2024.  
            Koenig
            LR, Becker A, Upadhyay UD. Telehealth medication
            abortion is safe and effective. Society of Family Planning.
            2023.  
            Koenig
            LR, Upadhyay UD. Virtual Clinics Offer Safe and
            Effective Abortion Care. Public Health Post. 2021.  
            Zia
            Y, Koenig LR, Ko J, Upadhyay U. Safety and
            effectiveness of first-trimester medication abortion in the
            United States. Oakland, California: Advancing New Standards
            in Reproductive Health.
